item.title: Court House
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row css=".vc_custom_1526634831293{margin-bottom: 50px !important;}"][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_single_image source="featured_image" img_size="full"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][gt3_spacing height="25px"][vc_custom_heading source="post_title" font_container="tag:h2|font_size:38|text_align:left|line_height:1.5em" use_theme_fonts="yes"][gt3_spacing height="12px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="28" line_height="145"]A Personal Injury suit can come up when someone is harmed[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="23px"][vc_column_text]The harm occurred can be physical, mental, or even financial. Personal Injury suits are typically resolved in one of two ways: through a formal lawsuit, or through informal, out-of-court negotiations between the parties involved. There is often a time limit for when one person can file a claim against another for personal injury. For cases where the personal injury suit is due to the breach of a contract, the Statute of Limitations is 4 years for written contracts, and 2 years for oral contracts.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1526633967735{background-color: #f8f8f8 !important;}"][vc_column width="1/3" css=".vc_custom_1526634764090{padding-top: 0px !important;}"][gt3_spacing height="72px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="28"]

Challenge

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="14px"][vc_column_text]The types of damages that can be claimed in a personal injury suit. Here is a run down of some common types of damages:[/vc_column_text][gt3_spacing height="19px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="18" line_height="215"]
  1. Compensation for medical bills accrued
  2. Pain and suffering
  3. Lost wages as a result of the injury
  4. Emotional distress
  5. Wrongful death
[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="38px"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3" css=".vc_custom_1526634768426{padding-top: 0px !important;}"][gt3_spacing height="72px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="28"]

Solution

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="14px"][vc_column_text]Consumers should be able to trust that the products they purchase are safe when used as designed. Unfortunately, consumers are often injured by common products and devices they use every day. Design defects: This is the case where a product imperfection occurs when the seller or distributor could have reduced or avoided a foreseeable risk of harm.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3" css=".vc_custom_1526634772397{padding-top: 0px !important;}"][gt3_spacing height="72px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="28"]

Results

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="14px"][vc_single_image image="437" img_size="full"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][gt3_spacing height="62px"][gt3_custom_text separator="yes" separator_color="rgba(39,43,46,0.2)" text_color="#272b2e" font_size="32"]

item.content:encoded:

[/vc_column_text][gt3_spacing height="20px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][gt3_spacing height="60px"][gt3_custom_text css_animation="fadeIn" text_color="" font_size="" line_height=""]

Paragraphs

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="20px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text css_animation="bottom-to-top"]In this age of sophisticated business environments, digital information systems, and complex legal issues, we strive to understand your legal needs from the inside out. At O’Connor, we feel it is important to function as though we were part of your “life” management team. This unique insider’s point of view gives us the edge in “preventative law” and when necessary, the edge in full blown litigation. The law continues to change dramatically and we are dedicated to embracing these changes by creating progressive and unique solutions to our clients’ legal, business and personal needs. In addition to our general business and litigation practice, we offer extensive expertise in various areas of law. These areas include personal injury, family law, employment and discrimination, real estate law, tax and estate planning, intellectual property law, bankruptcy (creditors), agricultural law and financing arrangements, trust administration, probate, and estate related litigation.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][gt3_spacing height="60px"][gt3_custom_text css_animation="fadeIn" text_color="" font_size="" line_height=""]

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="20px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text css_animation="bottom-to-top"]In this age of sophisticated business environments, digital information systems, and complex legal issues, we strive to understand your legal needs from the inside out. At O’Connor, we feel it is important to function as though we were part of your “life” management team. This unique insider’s point of view gives us the edge in “preventative law” and when necessary, the edge in full blown litigation. The law continues to change dramatically and we are dedicated to embracing these changes by creating progressive and unique solutions to our clients’ legal, business and personal needs.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][gt3_spacing height="60px"][gt3_custom_text css_animation="fadeIn" text_color="" font_size="" line_height=""]

Dropcaps

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="20px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text css_animation="bottom-to-top"]We’re a financial and consulting business company of professional thinkers, strategists, digital innovators, designers and problem solvers (everyone gets a mention). Our sense of curiosity brings thinkers, strategists, digital innovators, designers and problem solvers (everyone gets a mention). Our sense of curiosity brings brands to life, gets them talking, and makes sure they’re heard above brands to life, gets them talking, and makes sure they’re heard above. In this age of sophisticated business environments, digital information systems, and complex legal issues, we strive to understand your legal needs.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][gt3_spacing height="60px"][gt3_custom_text css_animation="fadeIn" text_color="" font_size="" line_height=""]

Blockquote

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="20px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text css_animation="bottom-to-top"]
The end of law is not to abolish or restrain, but to preserve and enlarge freedom. For in all the states of created beings capable of law, where there is no law, there is no freedom.
- by John Doe, Company CEO [/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][gt3_spacing height="60px"][gt3_custom_text css_animation="fadeIn" text_color="" font_size="" line_height=""]

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="16" css=".vc_custom_1526046460154{padding-top: 7px !important;}"]Domestic battery, corporal injury to a spouse or cohabitant, criminal threats, child abuse.[/gt3_custom_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="22"]

Fraud

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="16" css=".vc_custom_1526046500434{padding-top: 7px !important;}"]Forgery, auto insurance fraud, check fraud, credit card fraud, health care fraud, identity theft.[/gt3_custom_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="22"]

Driving Crimes

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="16" css=".vc_custom_1526046517781{padding-top: 7px !important;}"]DUI, Vehicular manslaughter, driving on a suspended license, driving without a license, hit and run.[/gt3_custom_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="22"]

Drug Crimes

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="16" css=".vc_custom_1526046534018{padding-top: 7px !important;}"]Possession of substances, possession for sale, manufacturing, under the influence, diversion.[/gt3_custom_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][gt3_spacing height="46px" responsive_es="yes" height_mobile="0"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="22"]

Personal Injury

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="16" css=".vc_custom_1526047119077{padding-top: 7px !important;}"]Law relating to psychological injury due to the actions of another person, company or other entity.[/gt3_custom_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="22"]

Gun Crimes

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="16" css=".vc_custom_1526046594869{padding-top: 7px !important;}"]Unlawful possession of firearms, carrying a concealed weapon, firearm conversion, brandishing.[/gt3_custom_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="22"]

Juvenile Crimes

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="16" css=".vc_custom_1526047068664{padding-top: 7px !important;}"]602 Proceedings, wards of the court, sealing of juvenile records,rehabilitation cases where a minor is tried.[/gt3_custom_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="22"]

Theft

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="16" css=".vc_custom_1526046621759{padding-top: 7px !important;}"]Defenses for petty theft, grand theft, robbery, burglary, auto burglary, embezzlemen.[/gt3_custom_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][gt3_spacing height="83px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1527856512509{background: #8e9290 url(https://livewp.site/wp/md/oconnor/wp-content/uploads/sites/44/2018/06/image31.jpg?id=679) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}"][vc_column width="2/3" offset="vc_col-md-6"][gt3_spacing height="100px"][gt3_custom_text separator="yes" separator_color="rgba(249,249,250,0.2)" text_color="#f8f8f9" font_size="32"]

Integrity & Commitment

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="16px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#ffffff" font_size="22"]If you have been arrested, you need a knowledgeable, determined criminal defense attorney supporting you. [vc_row][vc_column][gt3_spacing height="85px"][vc_row_inner gap="30"][vc_column_inner width="1/3" css=".vc_custom_1526383276020{border-right-width: 1px !important;padding-top: 0px !important;border-right-color: #e9eded !important;border-right-style: solid !important;}"][gt3_custom_text separator="yes" separator_color="rgba(39,43,46,0.2)" text_color="#272b2e" font_size="32"]

Why You Need the Top Lawyers in O’Connor

[/gt3_custom_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="18"]We’re a financial and consulting business company of professional thinkers, strategists, digital innovators, designers and problem solvers (everyone gets a mention). Our sense of curiosity brings[/gt3_custom_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="18"]thinkers, strategists, digital innovators, designers and problem solvers (everyone gets a mention). Our sense of curiosity brings brands to life, gets them talking, and makes sure they’re heard above.[/gt3_custom_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][gt3_spacing height="85px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" content_placement="middle" css=".vc_custom_1526390281302{background-color: #f8f8f8 !important;}"][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1526390485886{padding-top: 10px !important;}"][gt3_spacing height="30px"][gt3_custom_text separator="yes" separator_color="rgba(39,43,46,0.2)" text_color="#272b2e" font_size="32"]

We Will Fight For You

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="18"]Our attorneys are experienced in all major areas of criminal and DUI defense at the state, federal, and appellate level.[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="26px"][vc_progress_bar values="%5B%7B%22label%22%3A%22CONSULTATION%22%2C%22value%22%3A%2275%22%2C%22color%22%3A%22custom%22%2C%22customcolor%22%3A%22%23c2b697%22%2C%22customtxtcolor%22%3A%22%23272b2e%22%7D%2C%7B%22label%22%3A%22PRACTICE%22%2C%22value%22%3A%2290%22%2C%22color%22%3A%22custom%22%2C%22customcolor%22%3A%22%23c2b697%22%2C%22customtxtcolor%22%3A%22%23272b2e%22%7D%2C%7B%22label%22%3A%22MEDIATION%22%2C%22value%22%3A%2260%22%2C%22color%22%3A%22custom%22%2C%22customcolor%22%3A%22%23c2b697%22%2C%22customtxtcolor%22%3A%22%23272b2e%22%7D%5D" bgcolor="white" units="%"][gt3_spacing height="30px"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1526390560512{margin-right: -46px !important;padding-top: 0px !important;padding-right: 0px !important;padding-bottom: 0px !important;padding-left: 0px !important;}"][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row_content"][vc_column width="1/3" css=".vc_custom_1526391341546{padding-top: 0px !important;padding-right: 0px !important;padding-bottom: 0px !important;padding-left: 0px !important;background-color: #47414f !important;}"][gt3_spacing height="73px"][gt3_custom_text separator="yes" separator_color="rgba(249,249,250,0.2)" margin_top="17" maxwidth="18%" text_color="#ffffff" font_size="28" line_height="145" item_el_class="max_width-280 gt3_margin_auto"]

We Provide Solid Law Practice

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="23px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#ffffff" font_size="16" line_height="145" item_el_class="max_width-280 gt3_margin_auto"]We are dedicated to your best interests. Our nationally recognized law firm has the experience, ingenuity, and expertise that you are looking for.[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="30px"][gt3_button button_title="READ MORE" btn_border_style="none" btn_icon_fontawesome="theme_icon-arrows-right" use_theme_button="no" btn_bg_color="" btn_bg_color_hover="" btn_text_color="#ffffff" btn_text_color_hover="#c2b697" btn_icon_color="#ffffff" btn_icon_color_hover="#c2b697" btn_border_color="#c2b697" btn_border_color_hover="#e8e8e8" button_alignment="left" btn_icon_type="font" btn_icon_position="right" link="url:%23|||" css=".vc_custom_1526902649804{padding-top: 0px !important;padding-right: 0px !important;padding-bottom: 0px !important;padding-left: 0px !important;}" item_el_class="gt3_margin_auto max_width-280"][gt3_spacing height="65px"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3" css=".vc_custom_1526391882314{padding-top: 0px !important;padding-right: 0px !important;padding-bottom: 0px !important;padding-left: 0px !important;background-color: #ccbd99 !important;}"][gt3_spacing height="73px"][gt3_custom_text separator="yes" separator_color="rgba(249,249,250,0.2)" margin_top="17" maxwidth="18%" text_color="#ffffff" font_size="28" line_height="145" item_el_class="max_width-280 gt3_margin_auto"]

Aggressive Criminal Defense

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="23px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#ffffff" font_size="16" line_height="145" item_el_class="max_width-280 gt3_margin_auto"]We have a reputation for representing our clients aggressively and affordably. item.title: Lounge Music For Your Mood
item.dc:creator: kate
item.content:encoded:
If you are facing a criminal charge, no matter how minor, you should talk to a defense attorney to fully understand your case.

A consultation with an experienced attorney will help you to understand the charges placed against you, the defenses available, what if any plea bargains may be offered to you, and what you should do if you are convicted. We offer free consultations – just contact us. If you are facing a serious charge, however, it is highly recommended that you have a skilled defense attorney represent you in court. Criminal defense attorneys represent people who have a lawsuit filed against them or are charged with criminal conduct. We focus our practice on criminal defensein the California area, so we often know the prosecutors involved, can get negotiations concessions that other attorneys may not have access to, and have already handled many cases similar to yours.

What Does A Defense Attorney Do?

If you are looking at prison time or a criminal penalty, it is extremely important to hire a criminal defense lawyer. The legal system is designed and biased so that representing yourself in a criminal trial and expecting a good result is almost impossible. A great criminal defense lawyer knows the ins and outs of the legal system, and may be able to spot certain arguments and factors that could mitigate or even negate a potential crime. Hiring a criminal defense lawyer has multiple benefits and provides you the opportunity to the best possible outcome for your trial, which you would not be able to achieve on your own. For example, a criminal defense lawyer can:
  1. Point out legal rules and regulations. Many rules and laws about criminal prosecutions are buried within regulations and laws, and even prior court opinions.
  2. Work with you and the prosecutor to negotiate a plea bargains, if necessary. A plea bargain can often reduce your potential sentence or eliminate some.
  3. Your criminal defense attorney may be able to negotiate your sentence to prevent you from winding back in court house.
In addition to these, a criminal defense lawyer can provide you peace of mind. You can rest assured that your criminal defense lawyer is going to do their best to defend you and achieve the highest possible outcome for you- whether it is getting the charges dropped in an unjust case, or negotiating a fair sentencing in the case that you are found guilty.
The end of law is not to abolish or restrain, but to preserve and enlarge freedom. For in all the states of created beings capable of law
- by John Doe, Company CEO

item.title: Theft
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded:
A Personal Injury suit can come up when someone is harmed, either by accident or through intentional injury, and somebody else may be legally responsible.

The harm occurred can be physical, mental, or even financial. Personal Injury suits are typically resolved in one of two ways: through a formal lawsuit, or through informal, out-of-court negotiations between the parties involved. There is often a time limit for when one person can file a claim against another for personal injury. This is known as the Statute of Limitations. Typically, the deadline to file a claim is 2 years after the injury occurred. However, there are instances in which an injury is not properly identified until years later, in which case the statute of limitations is 1 year after the injury was identified. For cases where the personal injury suit is due to the breach of a contract, the Statute of Limitations is 4 years for written contracts, and 2 years for oral contracts. For claims against a government agency, the suit must be filed within 6 months (1 year for certain cases) of the incident. For a more in-depth list various offenses and their specific Statute of Limitations, check out the California Court System’s guide.  

Types of Damages

The types of damages that can be claimed in a personal injury suit vary widely depending on the individual case. Here is a run down of some common types of damages:
  1. Compensation for medical bills accrued due to the injury
  2. Pain and suffering
  3. Lost wages as a result of the injury
  4. Emotional distress
  5. Wrongful death

Shared Fault Laws

Shared fault, or comparative fault, is the most common defense to personal injury suits. Shared fault raises the claim that the injured party is in part to blame for the harm occurred, typically through negligence. In the state of California, if shared fault can be identified, the amount of compensation the injured party is entitled to receive may be reduced by the amount that equal to the percentage of fault for the accident.

Dog Attacks – “Strict Liability”

While most states carry a “one-bite rule”, in which the dog’s owner is not held liable for a bite so long as the dog has never bitten or shown aggressive tendencies before, the state of California classifies dog bites under “Strict Liability”. This means that regardless of the dog’s previous behavior, the owner is liable for any injury it might cause.

item.title: Juvenile Crimes
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded:
A Personal Injury suit can come up when someone is harmed, either by accident or through intentional injury, and somebody else may be legally responsible.

The harm occurred can be physical, mental, or even financial. Personal Injury suits are typically resolved in one of two ways: through a formal lawsuit, or through informal, out-of-court negotiations between the parties involved. There is often a time limit for when one person can file a claim against another for personal injury. This is known as the Statute of Limitations. Typically, the deadline to file a claim is 2 years after the injury occurred. However, there are instances in which an injury is not properly identified until years later, in which case the statute of limitations is 1 year after the injury was identified. item.title: Special Master Delays High-Stakes Report on $75M Class Action Fee Request
item.dc:creator: kate
item.content:encoded:
If you are facing a criminal charge, no matter how minor, you should talk to a defense attorney to fully understand your case.

A consultation with an experienced attorney will help you to understand the charges placed against you, the defenses available, what if any plea bargains may be offered to you, and what you should do if you are convicted. We offer free consultations – just contact us. If you are facing a serious charge, however, it is highly recommended that you have a skilled defense attorney represent you in court. Criminal defense attorneys represent people who have a lawsuit filed against them or are charged with criminal conduct. We focus our practice on criminal defensein the California area, so we often know the prosecutors involved, can get negotiations concessions that other attorneys may not have access to, and have already handled many cases similar to yours.

What Does A Defense Attorney Do?

If you are looking at prison time or a criminal penalty, it is extremely important to hire a criminal defense lawyer. The legal system is designed and biased so that representing yourself in a criminal trial and expecting a good result is almost impossible. A great criminal defense lawyer knows the ins and outs of the legal system, and may be able to spot certain arguments and factors that could mitigate or even negate a potential crime. Hiring a criminal defense lawyer has multiple benefits and provides you the opportunity to the best possible outcome for your trial, which you would not be able to achieve on your own. For example, a criminal defense lawyer can:
  1. Point out legal rules and regulations. Many rules and laws about criminal prosecutions are buried within regulations and laws, and even prior court opinions.
  2. Work with you and the prosecutor to negotiate a plea bargains, if necessary. A plea bargain can often reduce your potential sentence or eliminate some.
  3. Your criminal defense attorney may be able to negotiate your sentence to prevent you from winding back in court house.
In addition to these, a criminal defense lawyer can provide you peace of mind. You can rest assured that your criminal defense lawyer is going to do their best to defend you and achieve the highest possible outcome for you- whether it is getting the charges dropped in an unjust case, or negotiating a fair sentencing in the case that you are found guilty.
The end of law is not to abolish or restrain, but to preserve and enlarge freedom. For in all the states of created beings capable of law
- by John Doe, Company CEO

item.title: Peter Abrams
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="28"]

Personal Experience

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="18px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="18"]Martin Williams was born and raised in Fresno, California. He earned his bachelor's degree from California State University, Fresno, in 1980. He obtained his Juris Doctorate degree from San Joaquin College of Law and was admitted to practice law in 1987. While at San Joaquin College of Law, he was the editor of the law school newspaper, The Dicta. In 2011, Mr. Paboojian was inducted into the San Joaquin College of Law Hall of Fame because of his outstanding trial advocacy. In 2017, Mr. Williams was selected Cal-Abota trial lawyer of the year. In 2008, the Consumer Attorneys of California (CAOC) selected Mr. Williams as their trial lawyer of the year. Mr. Williams practices in the area of personal injury which primarily encompasses catastrophic personal injury, wrongful death, medical malpractice, and wrongful termination.[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="33px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="28"]

Verdicts & Settlements

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="18px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="18"]He has obtained over $100,000,000.00 in verdicts and settlements on behalf of his clients. In 2007, He obtained the largest employment verdict against a public entity in the United States for $19.1 Million. Personal Experience

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="18px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="18"]Martin Williams was born and raised in Fresno, California. He earned his bachelor's degree from California State University, Fresno, in 1980. He obtained his Juris Doctorate degree from San Joaquin College of Law and was admitted to practice law in 1987. While at San Joaquin College of Law, he was the editor of the law school newspaper, The Dicta. In 2011, Mr. Paboojian was inducted into the San Joaquin College of Law Hall of Fame because of his outstanding trial advocacy. In 2017, Mr. Williams was selected Cal-Abota trial lawyer of the year. In 2008, the Consumer Attorneys of California (CAOC) selected Mr. Williams as their trial lawyer of the year. Mr. Williams practices in the area of personal injury which primarily encompasses catastrophic personal injury, wrongful death, medical malpractice, and wrongful termination.[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="33px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="28"]

item.title: Personal Injury
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded:
A Personal Injury suit can come up when someone is harmed, either by accident or through intentional injury, and somebody else may be legally responsible.

The harm occurred can be physical, mental, or even financial. Personal Injury suits are typically resolved in one of two ways: through a formal lawsuit, or through informal, out-of-court negotiations between the parties involved. There is often a time limit for when one person can file a claim against another for personal injury. This is known as the Statute of Limitations. Typically, the deadline to file a claim is 2 years after the injury occurred. However, there are instances in which an injury is not properly identified until years later, in which case the statute of limitations is 1 year after the injury was identified. For cases where the personal injury suit is due to the breach of a contract, the Statute of Limitations is 4 years for written contracts, and 2 years for oral contracts. For claims against a government agency, the suit must be filed within 6 months (1 year for certain cases) of the incident. For a more in-depth list various offenses and their specific Statute of Limitations, check out the California Court System’s guide.  

Types of Damages

The types of damages that can be claimed in a personal injury suit vary widely depending on the individual case. Here is a run down of some common types of damages:
  1. Compensation for medical bills accrued due to the injury
  2. Pain and suffering
  3. Lost wages as a result of the injury
  4. Emotional distress
  5. Wrongful death

Shared Fault Laws

Shared fault, or comparative fault, is the most common defense to personal injury suits. Shared fault raises the claim that the injured party is in part to blame for the harm occurred, typically through negligence. In the state of California, if shared fault can be identified, the amount of compensation the injured party is entitled to receive may be reduced by the amount that equal to the percentage of fault for the accident.

Dog Attacks – “Strict Liability”

While most states carry a “one-bite rule”, in which the dog’s owner is not held liable for a bite so long as the dog has never bitten or shown aggressive tendencies before, the state of California classifies dog bites under “Strict Liability”. This means that regardless of the dog’s previous behavior, the owner is liable for any injury it might cause.

item.title: Drug Crimes
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded:
A Personal Injury suit can come up when someone is harmed, either by accident or through intentional injury, and somebody else may be legally responsible.

The harm occurred can be physical, mental, or even financial. Personal Injury suits are typically resolved in one of two ways: through a formal lawsuit, or through informal, out-of-court negotiations between the parties involved. There is often a time limit for when one person can file a claim against another for personal injury. This is known as the Statute of Limitations. Typically, the deadline to file a claim is 2 years after the injury occurred. However, there are instances in which an injury is not properly identified until years later, in which case the statute of limitations is 1 year after the injury was identified. For cases where the personal injury suit is due to the breach of a contract, the Statute of Limitations is 4 years for written contracts, and 2 years for oral contracts. For claims against a government agency, the suit must be filed within 6 months (1 year for certain cases) of the incident. For a more in-depth list various offenses and their specific Statute of Limitations, check out the California Court System’s guide.  

Types of Damages

The types of damages that can be claimed in a personal injury suit vary widely depending on the individual case. Here is a run down of some common types of damages:
  1. Compensation for medical bills accrued due to the injury
  2. Pain and suffering
  3. Lost wages as a result of the injury
  4. Emotional distress
  5. Wrongful death

Shared Fault Laws

Shared fault, or comparative fault, is the most common defense to personal injury suits. Shared fault raises the claim that the injured party is in part to blame for the harm occurred, typically through negligence. In the state of California, if shared fault can be identified, the amount of compensation the injured party is entitled to receive may be reduced by the amount that equal to the percentage of fault for the accident.

Dog Attacks – “Strict Liability”

While most states carry a “one-bite rule”, in which the dog’s owner is not held liable for a bite so long as the dog has never bitten or shown aggressive tendencies before, the state of California classifies dog bites under “Strict Liability”. This means that regardless of the dog’s previous behavior, the owner is liable for any injury it might cause.

item.title: Martin Williams
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="28"]

Personal Experience

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="18px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="18"]Martin Williams was born and raised in Fresno, California. He earned his bachelor's degree from California State University, Fresno, in 1980. He obtained his Juris Doctorate degree from San Joaquin College of Law and was admitted to practice law in 1987. While at San Joaquin College of Law, he was the editor of the law school newspaper, The Dicta. In 2011, Mr. Paboojian was inducted into the San Joaquin College of Law Hall of Fame because of his outstanding trial advocacy. In 2017, Mr. Williams was selected Cal-Abota trial lawyer of the year. In 2008, the Consumer Attorneys of California (CAOC) selected Mr. Williams as their trial lawyer of the year. Mr. Williams practices in the area of personal injury which primarily encompasses catastrophic personal injury, wrongful death, medical malpractice, and wrongful termination.[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="33px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="28"]

Verdicts & Settlements

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="18px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="18"]He has obtained over $100,000,000.00 in verdicts and settlements on behalf of his clients. In 2007, He obtained the largest employment verdict against a public entity in the United States for $19.1 Million. The following cases are some of the verdicts and settlements that Mr. Paboojian has obtained on behalf of his clients:[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="18px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="18" line_height="220"]
  • $ 19.1 Million – Stacy Johnson–Klein v. California State University, Fresno – Employment Case
  • $ 10 Million – John Doe v. Jane Doe Corporation – Auto Accident/Personal Injury
  • $ 9 Million – Jane Doe & John Doe v. Concrete Pumping Truck Company – Wrongful Death/Personal Injury
  • $ 5.7 Million – Gil Chavez v. D.R. Horton San Diego – Crane Accident/Spinal Cord Injury
  • $ 4 Million – Martin Rodriguez v. Jason Peden – Personal Injury/Spinal Cord Injury
[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="10px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="28"]

Organizations & Memberships

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="18px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="18"]

In 2008, Mr. Williams was president of the San Joaquin Valley Chapter of ABOTA. He has addressed a number of legal organizations, including San Joaquin College of Law, in the area of civility. From 2004-2006, he served on the Board of Directors for the Fresno County Bar Association. He has provided a number of lectures to various organizations including law schools, civic groups, and health care providers in the area of personal injury and wrongful termination.[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="35px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-md-6"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="28"]

Honors & Achievements

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="15px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="18" line_height="220"]
  1. 2018 CAL-ABOTA Trial Lawyer Of The Year
  2. 2017 Trial Lawyer of the Year
  3. Martindale-Hubbell AV Rated
  4. Super Lawyers' Top 100 Lawyers in California
[/gt3_custom_text][/vc_column][vc_column offset="vc_col-md-6"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="28"]

Honors & Achievements

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="11px"][vc_progress_bar values="%5B%7B%22label%22%3A%22CRIMINAL%20DEFENCE%22%2C%22value%22%3A%2290%22%2C%22color%22%3A%22custom%22%2C%22customcolor%22%3A%22%23c2b697%22%2C%22customtxtcolor%22%3A%22%23272b2e%22%7D%2C%7B%22label%22%3A%22DUI%20DEFENCE%22%2C%22value%22%3A%2275%22%2C%22color%22%3A%22custom%22%2C%22customcolor%22%3A%22%23c2b697%22%2C%22customtxtcolor%22%3A%22%23272b2e%22%7D%2C%7B%22label%22%3A%22PERSONAL%20INJURY%22%2C%22value%22%3A%2295%22%2C%22color%22%3A%22custom%22%2C%22customcolor%22%3A%22%23c2b697%22%2C%22customtxtcolor%22%3A%22%23272b2e%22%7D%5D" bgcolor="custom" units="%" custombgcolor="#efefef"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="28"]

Languages

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="18px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="18"]Greek (fluent), English (fluent), French, Italian.[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="41px"][vc_separator color="custom" accent_color="#d9dadc"][gt3_spacing height="64px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="28"]

Personal Injury suits are typically resolved in one of two ways: through a formal lawsuit, or through informal, out-of-court negotiations between the parties involved. There is often a time limit for when one person can file a claim against another for personal injury.
For cases where the personal injury suit is due to the breach of a contract, the Statute of Limitations is 4 years for written contracts, and 2 years for oral contracts.

item.title: Emma Stoun
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="28"]

Personal Experience

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="18px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="18"]Martin Williams was born and raised in Fresno, California. He earned his bachelor's degree from California State University, Fresno, in 1980. He obtained his Juris Doctorate degree from San Joaquin College of Law and was admitted to practice law in 1987. While at San Joaquin College of Law, he was the editor of the law school newspaper, The Dicta. In 2011, Mr. Paboojian was inducted into the San Joaquin College of Law Hall of Fame because of his outstanding trial advocacy. In 2017, Mr. Williams was selected Cal-Abota trial lawyer of the year. In 2008, the Consumer Attorneys of California (CAOC) selected Mr. Williams as their trial lawyer of the year. Mr. Williams practices in the area of personal injury which primarily encompasses catastrophic personal injury, wrongful death, medical malpractice, and wrongful termination.[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="33px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="28"]

Verdicts & Settlements

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="18px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="18"]He has obtained over $100,000,000.00 in verdicts and settlements on behalf of his clients. In 2007, He obtained the largest employment verdict against a public entity in the United States for $19.1 Million. The following cases are some of the verdicts and settlements that Mr. Paboojian has obtained on behalf of his clients:[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="18px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="18" line_height="220"]
  • $ 19.1 Million – Stacy Johnson–Klein v. California State University, Fresno – Employment Case
  • $ 10 Million – John Doe v. Jane Doe Corporation – Auto Accident/Personal Injury
  • $ 9 Million – Jane Doe & John Doe v. Concrete Pumping Truck Company – Wrongful Death/Personal Injury
  • $ 5.7 Million – Gil Chavez v. D.R. Horton San Diego – Crane Accident/Spinal Cord Injury
  • $ 4 Million – Martin Rodriguez v. Jason Peden – Personal Injury/Spinal Cord Injury
[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="10px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="28"]

Organizations & Memberships

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="18px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="18"]

In 2008, Mr. Williams was president of the San Joaquin Valley Chapter of ABOTA. He has addressed a number of legal organizations, including San Joaquin College of Law, in the area of civility. From 2004-2006, he served on the Board of Directors for the Fresno County Bar Association. He has provided a number of lectures to various organizations including law schools, civic groups, and health care providers in the area of personal injury and wrongful termination.[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="35px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-md-6"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="28"]

Honors & Achievements

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="15px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="18" line_height="220"]
  1. 2018 CAL-ABOTA Trial Lawyer Of The Year
  2. 2017 Trial Lawyer of the Year
  3. Martindale-Hubbell AV Rated
  4. Super Lawyers' Top 100 Lawyers in California
[/gt3_custom_text][/vc_column][vc_column offset="vc_col-md-6"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="28"]

Honors & Achievements

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="11px"][vc_progress_bar values="%5B%7B%22label%22%3A%22CRIMINAL%20DEFENCE%22%2C%22value%22%3A%2290%22%2C%22color%22%3A%22custom%22%2C%22customcolor%22%3A%22%23c2b697%22%2C%22customtxtcolor%22%3A%22%23272b2e%22%7D%2C%7B%22label%22%3A%22DUI%20DEFENCE%22%2C%22value%22%3A%2275%22%2C%22color%22%3A%22custom%22%2C%22customcolor%22%3A%22%23c2b697%22%2C%22customtxtcolor%22%3A%22%23272b2e%22%7D%2C%7B%22label%22%3A%22PERSONAL%20INJURY%22%2C%22value%22%3A%2295%22%2C%22color%22%3A%22custom%22%2C%22customcolor%22%3A%22%23c2b697%22%2C%22customtxtcolor%22%3A%22%23272b2e%22%7D%5D" bgcolor="custom" units="%" custombgcolor="#efefef"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="28"]

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="18px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="18"]Greek (fluent), English (fluent), French, Italian.[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="41px"][vc_separator color="custom" accent_color="#d9dadc"][gt3_spacing height="64px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#272b2e" font_size="28"]
